lines.gurmukhi: mn bc kRm huie iekqR CqRpiq Bey shj isMGwsn kY Aib inhcl rwj hY
lines.transliteration_english: Man Bach Kram Hui Ikatr Chhatrapati Bhaay , Sahaj Singhaasan Kai Abi Nihachal Raaj Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Guru-conscious person feels like a mighty king when he is able to concentrate his mind on words and acts as per the teachings of Gum. When he is able to rest in a state of equipoise, he feels like an emperor of infallible kingdom.

lines.gurmukhi: sq Aau sMqoK dieAw Drm ArQ myil pMc prvwn kIey gurmiq swj hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sat Au Santokh Daiaa Dharam Arad Mayli , Panch Paravaan Keeay Gurmati Saaj Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By imbibing the five virtues of Truth, Contentment, Compassion, Righteousness and Purpose in accordance with the teachings of the Gum, he becomes acceptable and an honourable person.

lines.gurmukhi: skl pdwrQ Aau srb inDwn sBw isv ngrI subws koit Cib Cwj hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sakal Padaarad Au Sarab Nidhaan Sabhaa , Siv Nagaree Soubaas Koti Chhabi Chhaaj Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: All materials and worldly treasures are his. The divine abode of Dasam Duar is his fort where the continuous presence of melodious Naam makes him a unique and glorious person.

lines.gurmukhi: rwjnIiq rIiq pRIiq prjw kY suKY suK pUrn mnorQ sPl sb kwj hY ]46]
lines.transliteration_english: Raajaneeti Reeti Preeti Parajaa Kai Soukhai Soukha , Pooran Manorad Sadhal Sab Kaaj Hai ?46?

Shabad OS B.translation: The loving and affectionate treatment of such a king-like disciple of the True Guru with other human beings is his statesmanship that spreads happiness, peace and success all around him. (46)
